snippet: U.S. Soccer on Monday confirmed the worst-kept secret about its national team, announcing that the United States would play Italy in Genoa on Feb. 29.
abstract: U.S. Soccer on Monday confirmed the worst-kept secret about its national team, announcing that the United States would play Italy in Genoa on Feb. 29.
lead_paragraph: U.S. Soccer on Monday confirmed the worst-kept secret about its national team, announcing that the United States would play Italy in Genoa on Feb. 29. That is the last official FIFA match date for friendlies before June, when the Americans start World Cup qualifying and the Italians begin play in the European championship.

headline.main: Confirmed: U.S. Will Play Italy in February
